info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:48PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, southeastern Franklin and north central Essex Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Placid, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Placid, Wilmington, Keene, Jay In Essex County, Mount Marcy, Keene Valley, North Elba, Upper Jay, Union Falls, Mount Van Hoevenberg, St. Huberts, Franklin Falls, Alder Brook, North Jay, and Mount Van Hoevenburg Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New York.
